New Records: Jared McCain scored a career-high 27 points
Guerschon Yabusele scored a career-high 20 points
Kyle Lowry moved past Tony Parker on the NBA’s all-time assists list with 7,038 assists
Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia 76ers (2-7) remain home to meet the New York Knicks (4-5) on Tuesday for their first 76ers Cup Night presented by Chick-fil-A
The Sixers enter the matchup after a 107-105 overtime victory Sunday over Charlotte, while the Knicks fell to Indiana, 132-121, in Indianapolis
It is the front end of a back-to-back for both clubs, with the Knicks hosting Chicago and the Sixers set to host the 12-0 Cleveland Cavaliers on Wednesday
The 2024-25 Knicks boast the second-rated offense in the NBA (119.5 points per 100 possessions) through their first nine games
Philadelphia leads the all-time regular season series 265-208 overall and 149-71 at home
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tuesday also marks the first game on the Sixers’ new blue court for Philadelphia 76ers Cup Nights presented by Chick-fil-A
The Sixers are scheduled to wear their red Statement Edition uniforms for the first time this season, with the Knicks in their white Association Edition uniforms
Others: Joel Embiid was not listed on the injury report entering gameday morning
Tyrese Maxey (right hamstring strain) remains out for the Sixers
Precious Achiuwa (left hamstring strain) and Mitchell Robinson (left ankle surgery) are out for the Knicks
Miles McBride (left knee inflammation) and Cameron Payne (left hamstring strain) are questionable

Jared McCain on guarding LaMelo Ball in overtime: 'For me, it’s kind of just being quiet. Everything is so loud around you, so just locking in on the ball and having a quiet mind. My psychologist calls it ‘feel the dance,’ and I just feel the flow and feel the dance and just wanted to get a stop, that’s all I wanted.'
